nodes.documentation:
Stores a FileContract on solidity, as an array of structs cannot easily be returned
 the structs must be decomposed by the UI
 simple FileContract contains ipfshash, filename, owner, tags and unix timestamp.
 Since we can't use an bytes32 array in solidity, I decided to have tag numbers
 corresponding to string names, almost like a dictionary look up.
nodes.name: FileContract

nodes.documentation: main event for smart contract, needed for drizzle to update list of files
nodes.name: fileAdded

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct FileContract.File storage ref[1000] storage ref)
struct FileContract.File storage ref[1000] storage ref

nodes.documentation:
Add a file to the list
 ipfshash an ipfshash returned after an image is finished uploaded
 _filename name of file as a bytes32 as filenames should be short
 tags array of bytes32 used for sorting/searching files (e,g. blockchain, school, textbook)
 updates mappings todos and lastIds
nodes.name: addFile

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct FileContract.File storage ref[1000] storage ref)
struct FileContract.File storage ref[1000] storage ref

nodes.documentation:
return the tags for a specific file
 owner --- address of person who uploaded the file
 _index --- the file desired, (first file uploaded, second , etc ...)
nodes.name: getFileTags

addFile(string,bytes32,bytes32[5]).notice: Add a file to the list ipfshash an ipfshash returned after an image is finished uploaded _filename name of file as a bytes32 as filenames should be short tags array of bytes32 used for sorting/searching files (e,g. blockchain, school, textbook) updates mappings todos and lastIds

getFileTags(address,uint256).notice: return the tags for a specific file owner --- address of person who uploaded the file _index --- the file desired, (first file uploaded, second , etc ...)
